page.title: 09The life of Rossina Lane.
page.content: Mrs Rossina Lane died on the 3'rd April 1985 at the age of{101.}Her husband was killed in the first world war. She had a daugther called Mary and a son Alan. She lived in Cornwall for some time but later moved to Brecon. On Mrs Lane 100'th Birthday received a telegram from the Queen and she also from many members of the Conservative Party. She was friendly with the Bishop of Brecon Cathedral and he visted reguarly.She was a great lover of animals and donated to many funds and organisations. She went to St. David's Hospital once a week where she made many friends. She used to buy dolls from Jumble Sales, knit clothes for them and then give them to other Jumble Sales. She enjoyed watching television especially sport. Her daughter Mary lived next door and helped her a great deal with work.
